1.title: Week 1
1.plot: Allison and Sterling return to the news room with their own microphones and lots of news to report from the first week, including a voting scandal, a fresh set of group names, and a missing on-site correspondent. Featuring a textaholic musician, the Lost and Found Fashion Show, and a fill-in on-site correspondent that seems to rub Sterling the wrong way.

2.title: Week 2
2.plot: Expert survivalist Jill Grylls and multi-millionaire CEO Trina Treble, anchors of the oft-overlooked Ten O'clock Special, finally get some prime screen time, only to be cut off. In other news, scripts and music have arrived at the camp, ninjas have overrun the studio, and the filmmakers engage in competition. Featuring a set of talented children and their parents, a pair of bodybuilders with lots of silly ideas, and the fill-in on-site correspondent that just can't seem to catch a break.

3.title: Week 3
3.plot: Allison and Sterling return from a short-lived Fourth of July celebration for another broadcast. As the final day of camp draws ever closer, Jill and Trina kickstart their plan to become the head anchors of the DO News Network. Featuring a pair of snack-sharing renegades, Gerard the algebra teacher and his less than sanitary students, slow motion falling, and a temperamental dance teacher.

4.title: Week 4
4.plot: In order to win back the news network, Sterling and Allison enlist the help of an old nemesis, but when their plans go wrong and it seems like all hope is lost, they receive a message from the one person they needed the most. Jill and Trina relish their time in the limelight, where they provide news on the day before the final camp performance. Featuring a sleepy trio of actors, a jetpack-toting mammal, and special guest anchor Sam Francisco!

1.title: Week 1
1.plot: Join Sterling Grillmaster, Allison Wonderland, and their lone and highly coveted microphone as they report the week's events at the DiscoveryOnstage Summer Acting Camp. Featuring an interview with the head of the B-1 Red Mystery and a PSA on abandoned goods.

2.title: Week 2
2.plot: The scripts have arrived, talent show sign-ups have begun, and as the days pass, campers and staff alike await the day of their final camp performance. Tensions between Grillmaster and Wonderland rise as the battle for the microphone no longer remains a silent one. Featuring a pair of severely traumatized twins, an evil doing boo boo-fixer and his porpoise partner, a safety and cleanliness-regulating duo, a highly ambitious filmmaker with the goal of finishing twenty feature films by two weeks' time, and a group of extremely talented individuals that do things as a ...

3.title: Week 3
3.plot: Independence Day Fever hits the camp and subsequently takes away a full day of activities, but it doesn't stop the committed campers and the stalwart staff from working towards their final camp performance. Allison and Sterling are paid a surprise visit from an unexpected guest. Featuring an award-winning musical duo, a survivalist hidden in plain sight, and a world-renowned curator, known for her work at the MuseÃ© d'Arte Moderne.

4.title: Week 4
4.plot: Last week's unexpected guest takes over the broadcast for the day... or forever. Sterling, Allison and Brian figure out a way to get their news broadcast back. Featuring a wild pair of eyebrows, a movie trailer so scary that children under 8 aren't allowed to watch it without adult supervision, and the most epic battle you'll ever see.

imdb.title: The DiscoveryOnstage News Network
plot: Join Sterling Grillmaster, Allison Wonderland, and the many faces of the DiscoveryOnstage Summer Acting Camp as they reportâEUR"and eventually becomeâEUR"the weekly news.
